com.youama.nexus.crawler

Class Url

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.youama.nexus.crawler.Url

  • public class Url
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the URL as a string, doesn't the content of the URL.
    Since:
    2015.06.27.
    Author:
    David Belicza <87.bdavid@gmail.com>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String domain
      Domain address from URL.
      protected java.lang.String extension
      File extension from current URL.
      protected java.lang.String[] extensions
      Most common, possible resource extensions.
      protected boolean resourceUrl
      Current URL is a kind of resource, depends by self.extensions property.
      protected boolean secure
      Url secure state by http or https sub string.
      protected java.lang.String url
      Url without HTTP definition.

    • Field Detail

      • url

        protected java.lang.String url
        Url without HTTP definition.

      • domain

        protected java.lang.String domain
        Domain address from URL.

      • extensions

        protected java.lang.String[] extensions
        Most common, possible resource extensions.

      • extension

        protected java.lang.String extension
        File extension from current URL. It can be fake extension.

      • resourceUrl

        protected boolean resourceUrl
        Current URL is a kind of resource, depends by self.extensions property.

      • secure

        protected boolean secure
        Url secure state by http or https sub string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Url

        public Url()

    • Method Detail

      • setUrl

        public void setUrl(java.lang.String url)
        It sets url to the property, removes the HTTP or HTTPS prefixes. It also sets the the secure state in the property. It resets the property values before it should sets the new values.
        Parameters:
        url - Any kind of url.

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Resetting of property - when setUrl() is called.

      • computeUrlWithProtocol

        protected java.lang.String computeUrlWithProtocol(java.lang.String url)
        It retrieves the URL without HTTP and HTTPS prefixes. It sets the secure property to true when URL starts by https:// string.
        Parameters:
        url - Any kind of URL.
        Returns:
        The URL without HTTP and HTTPS.

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        It retrieves the url from property without http prefix.
        Returns:
        The url.

      • setDomainFromUrl

        protected void setDomainFromUrl()
        It finds the domain address in the URL and sets it to the property.

      • getDomain

        public java.lang.String getDomain()
        It retrieves the domain address.
        Returns:
        Typical domain address.

      • isSecure

        public boolean isSecure()
        It retrieves the url in the property is secure or not.
        Returns:
        True when it is secure.

      • isResourceExtension

        protected boolean isResourceExtension(java.lang.String extension)
        It retrieves the given string is a resource file extension or is not, e.g. css, js. It is defined in the property.
        Parameters:
        extension - Any kind of file extension. It also can be wrong extension.
        Returns:
        It is true when this is a resource extension.

      • getExtensionFromUrl

        protected java.lang.String getExtensionFromUrl()
        It retrieves the extension from url, e.g. "css" from domain.com/style.css.
        Returns:
        Extension. It can be a non defined extension.

      • isResourceUrl

        public boolean isResourceUrl()
        It retrieves the URL is a resource URL or is not. Before retrieve the return value it saves to the property.
        Returns:
        It is true in case of "domain.com/test.css" or "domain.com/test.js" for example.
